column12: ORTHOPEDIC SURGICAL SYSTEM INCLUDING SURGICAL ACCESS SYSTEMS, DISTRACTION SYSTEMS, AND METHODS OF USING SAME
column13: A surgical distraction system is disclosed comprising, first and second pins, each pin configured for insertion into bone, and a distractor device. The distractor device includes first and second elongated members pivotably coupled together, each of which includes a flat portion disposed on a lateral side thereof. The flat portions are substantially parallel to each other and in abutting relationship when the distractor device is in a closed position, and substantially parallel to each other and laterally spaced apart when in an open position. Each of the first and second elongated members is configured to releasably engage one of the first and second pins. A method of creating separation between adjacent vertebral bodies is also disclosed. 306a -308 308 202 202 306a 30ALu 210" 210" 304 304 210 CD -,-- 304 _200- 210, 200 300b 300a - CD,, 302 306- , 314 306b 210" 20 308 \L--306b
column15: ANGUS OLIVIA;;BROWN MICHAEL;;COLE CHAD;;ELSKENS DANIEL;;KUNES BRIAN

column12: ORTHOPEDIC SURGICAL SYSTEM INCLUDING SURGICAL ACCESS SYSTEMS, DISTRACTION SYSTEMS, AND METHODS OF USING SAME
column13: A surgical access system includes a first connector including an arm, a coupling element, a rod, and a ridged slider. The arm includes first and second notched sections disposed in opposed lateral sides of the arm. The coupling element includes a body section defining an opening therethrough, and opposed tabs protruding from the body section that are configured to receive the second notched section of the arm therebetween such that the arm is pivotably coupled to the coupling element. The rod includes a shaft having a plurality of angled grooves defined partially along a length thereof. The rod extends through the opening of the coupling element and the first notched section of the arm. The ridged slider includes a first surface having a plurality of ridges extending along a partial length thereof. The ridged slider extends through the coupling element with the plurality of ridges operably engaged with the plurality of angled grooves of the rod. 314 -- 210" 210" > 304 304 - 304 -, -D 210 CD--- 304 200 210 200 -+300b 300a 302 _,314 306b--- T 30 21" \ 306b

column12: Orthopedic Surgical System Including Surgical Access Systems, Distraction Systems, And Methods Of Using Same
column13: A surgical access system includes a connector including an arm, a coupling element, a rod, and a ridged slider. The arm includes first and second notched sections disposed in opposed lateral sides thereof. The coupling element includes a body section defining an opening therethrough, and opposed tabs protruding therefrom that are configured to receive the second notched section therebetween such that the arm is pivotably coupled to the coupling element. The rod includes a shaft having a plurality of angled grooves defined partially along a length thereof. The rod extends through the opening of the coupling element and the first notched section of the arm. The ridged slider includes a first surface having a plurality of ridges extending along a partial length thereof. The ridged slider extends through the coupling element with the plurality of ridges operably engaged with the plurality of angled grooves of the rod.
